supportDesc.support: Paper. Watermark: an angel in a circle, surrounded by a star (Briquet 650 [an. 1570, 1576]), similar to Briquet 643. See T. Antonopoulou, Leonis VI Sapientis Imperatoris Byzantini Homiliae p. xxxi, fn. 32.

decoDesc.decoNote: Various decorative head-pieces in red ink preceding each sermon. Large initial decorative letters in the beginning of each text.

binding.p:
Typical Holkham binding of black leather, with Coke family ostrich crest in gilt in the centre of the upper cover; Date: early nineteenth century. Rebound by John Jones of Liverpool (worked for Holkham 1816–1823). The spine lettered in gilt: LEONIS IMP. OPUSCULA GR. M.S. SÆC. XII. In pasted black leather: MS.
HOLK.
Gr. 62
